task.title: Task: Database save as
task.shortdesc: Instructions on how to save a database with a new name in an older file format.

context.p: Sometimes it may be desirable to have multiple versions of a file. In that case, you can use Save As to save the file with a new name. And if you want to save the file in an older Access format you can also use Save As.

In this course, a database with the name will be used. Because all changes you make will be saved immediately without asking, you soon won't have the original database. It is therefore recommended to start with making a copy of the original database , before you are going to work with this database. You can do that at the file level with the Windows explorer, but you can also use the Save As command in Access.

step.cmd: Select Access Database (*.accdband click Save As.
Browse in the dialog window to the storage location, specify the name of the new file, and click Save.

taskbody.example:
BackupA backup is nothing more than a copy of a database that you have created at a certain moment. In fact, it is the same process as with the Save As command. Nevertheless, Access provides in a Backup function.
Choose File Save As . Select in the window Back Up Database and click Save As. Afterthat, you can specify the storage location and file name. Default, the proposed name is the name of the original database file supplemented with the current date. When you restore data or objects from a backup, you want to know which database the backup came from and when the backup was created. Therefore, it is usually a good idea to use the proposed default file name.
